docblock.description: Caching of serialized LudoDBObjects User: Alf Magne Date: 28.01.13

docblock.long-description: This is a LudoDBModel storing data as serialized strings in the database. When caching is enabled for a service, LudoDBRequestHandler will attempt to retrieve data from cache before calling the service method. This may save time for services requiring many SQL queries to complete.

property.name: $config
property.default: array('table' => 'ludo_db_cache', 'sql' => "select class_name, cache_key, cache_value from ludo_db_cache where cache_key=?", 'idField' => 'JSON_key', 'columns' => array('id' => array('db' => 'int auto_increment not null primary key'), 'cache_key' => array('db' => 'varchar(512)', 'access' => 'rw'), 'class_name' => array('db' => 'varchar(512)', 'access' => 'rw'), 'cache_value' => array('db' => 'mediumtext', 'access' => 'rw')), 'indexes' => array('cache_key', 'class_name'))

docblock.long-description: An empty LudoDBService class is sent to the constructor along with constructor arguments. The cache class will search for records where "class_name" equals class of given service and arguments compiled to a key matches cache_key in the database table.

docblock.description: Return cache key based on class name and arguments.
Returns true if cache data exists.
Set class name for new cache record
Set cache_key of new cache record
Clear cache records from db where cache_key equals key
Clear all cache record for given class name / resource.
LudoDB collection class User: Alf Magne Kalleland Date: 19.12.12

docblock.long-description:
Example of implementation:

With external config in JSON file:

PHP:

 class People extends LudoDBCollection
 {
     protected $JSONConfig = true;
 }

JSON in JSONConfig/People.json:

{
   "model": "Person",
   "sql": "select firstname, lastname, nick_name, p.zip,c.city from person p left join city c on c.zip = p.zip where p.zip=?",
   "columns": ["firstname", "lastname", "nick_name","zip", "city"]
}

Example with internal PHP config:

class DemoCities extends LudoDBCollection
{
   protected $config = array(
       "sql" => "select * from demo_city order by name",
       "model" => "DemoCity"
   );
}

docblock.description: Lookup value to use when instantiating collection.

docblock.long-description:
This value will not be committed to db until a call to commit is made. Example:

public function setFirstName($name){
     $this->setValue('firstname', $name');
}

docblock.description: Update column value of external column

docblock.long-description: commit is by default enabled

Example:

$person = new Person();
$person->setFirstname('John');
$person->setLastname('Johnson');
$person->commit();
echo $person->getId();

docblock.description: Execute commit on classes for external columns.

You need to call yesImSure afterwards. Example:

$person = new Person();
$person->drop()->yesImSure();

docblock.description: Delete all data from this table.
docblock.long-description:
You need to call yesImSure afterwards. Example:

$person = new Person();
$person->deleteTableData()->yesImSure();

http://localhost/LudoDBProfiling/Person/1/read/profile User: Alf Magne Kalleland Date: 18.02.13 Time: 20:48

docblock.long-description:
This resources requires that you have the xhprof module enabled on your Apache web server. It's also easiest to use when you have the mod rewrite module enabled Syntax LudoDBProfiling/resourceToProfile/arg1/arg2/resourceServiceToProfile/profile i.e first argument is LudoDBProfiling and last argument should be profile. The arguments in between is the request you want to profile, example

http://localhost/LudoDBProfiling/Person/1/read/profile

docblock.description: Returning "profile" as only valid service method
Number of arguments has to be equal or bigger than 2 (resource + service name).
Return empty string on successful profiling.

LudoDB Request Handler - Handle WebService requests
Request handler class for Front End Controller.
docblock.long-description: This class will handle requests sent by Views and pass them to the correct LudoDBObject's. User: Alf Magne Kalleland Date: 13.01.13

docblock.description: Internal array of valid services for given resource.
Key used in response from service handler.

docblock.long-description:
router.template.php can be used as a template on how to create a controller for a request handler.

Example code:

require_once(dirname(__FILE__)."/autoload.php");
require_once("php/jsonwrapper/jsonwrapper.php");
date_default_timezone_set("Europe/Berlin");
if(file_exists("connection.php")){
    require("connection.php");
}

LudoDBRegistry::set('DEVELOP_MODE', true);
LudoDB::enableLogging();

$request = array('request' => isset($_GET['request']) ? $_GET['request'] : $_POST['request']);

if(isset($_POST['data'])){
    $request['data'] = isset($_POST['data']) ? $_POST['data'] : null;
}

if(isset($_POST['arguments'])){
    $request['arguments'] = $_POST['arguments'];
}

$handler = new LudoDBRequestHandler();
echo $handler->handle($request);

docblock.description: Returned request sent to handler in valid internal format.
Return data from handler in JSON format.
Get arguments from request sent to handler.
Get name of resource for request.
Return valid services for handled resource.
Use Reflection to get instance of resource class
Return name of resource/class to be handled.

User: Alf Magne Kalleland Date: 12.02.13 Time: 23:14

docblock.long-description: By registering LudoDBService classes, you may get an overview of all the resources and services you have available.
If you need access to all available services, you can call LudoDBServiceRegistry::getAll(). Argument is name of a LudoDBService class.

docblock.description: Return array of all registered service resources with service names.

docblock.long-description:
Example of use of LudoDBTreeCollection

 class TestNodesWithLeafs extends LudoDBTreeCollection implements LudoDBService{
     protected $config = array(
         "sql" => "select * from test_node order by parent,id",
         "childKey" => "children",
         "model" => "TestNode",
         "fk" => "parent",
         "pk" => "id",
         "static" => array(
             "type" => "node"
         ),
         "merge" => array(
             array(
                 "class" => "LeafNodes",
                 "fk" => "parent_node_id",
                 "pk" => "id"
             )
        )
     );

     public function validateArguments($service, $arguments){
         return count($arguments) === 0;
     }

     public function validateServiceData($service, $data){
         return true;
     }

     public function getValidServices(){
         return array('read');
     }

     public function shouldCache($service){
         return $service === "read";
     }
 }

docblock.description: Return values in a tree structure

docblock.long-description: User: Alf Magne Date: 06.02.13

docblock.description: User: Alf Magne Kalleland Date: 17.04.13 Time: 21:37
Singleton class used to validate data before they are inserted into the database

docblock.long-description:
firstName => array(
 "db" => "varchar(64)",
 "validation" => array(
     "required" => true
 )
)

length of string Example:

firstName => array(
 "db" => "varchar(64)",
 "validation" => array(
     "minLength" => 5
 )
)

length of string Example:

firstName => array(
 "db" => "varchar(64)",
 "validation" => array(
     "maxLength" => 5
 )
)

numeric value Example:

firstName => array(
 "db" => "varchar(64)",
 "validation" => array(
     "minValue" => 5,
     "maxValue" => 10
 )
)

numeric value Example:

firstName => array(
 "db" => "varchar(64)",
 "validation" => array(
     "minValue" => 5,
     "maxValue" => 10
 )
)

numeric value Example:

firstName => array(
 "db" => "varchar(64)",
 "validation" => array(
     "regex" => "^[0-9]+$"
 )
)
User: Alf Magne Kalleland Date: 13.04.13 Time: 15:59

This class outputs LudoJS config objects for LudoDB instances

Example where LudoJS config for LudoDBModel Person is returned with values of Person with id equals 1:

$handler = new LudoDBRequestHandler();
echo $handler->handle('LudoJS/Person/1/form');

This will return the config as a JSON string.

docblock.description: Reference to the LudoDBObject to handle
Accepted number of arguments is 1 or 2 (second argument is optional "id" of resource)
No data is allowed to this service
Returns empty string as on success message for service
Update child array with default properties when not specified in config, example "label"
Return data source config with values for columns.
Return childrne in correct order according to "order" attribute
Add validation properties to LudoJS column
Returns true if given string matches pattern for a regex flag/modifiers
Use Reflection to get instance of resource class
